data.title: Looking for Tamales
data.text: I've been looking for a place to buy tamales, and someone told me to try Carmelita's.  Nice restaurant, clean, and friendly service.  I'm still looking for tamales, though, unfortunately.  These were pork, but there wasn't much.  It was mostly breading.  I'm sure their food is great, but I'm specifically on the hunt for tamales I can eat at home.

data.title: Carmelita's
data.text: Good food and good service.  Nice friendly place. The wait staff knew their business. This is a place I would recommend.

data.title: Salty Mexican???
data.text:
Now this is actually a good review. The place is nice and easily located in Conroe. The food is ordinarily as far as I can tell at daily lunch buffet. Not too much too chose between but all is good and home made. Of course it's Mexican style. This is NOT Tex-Mex. Which is good for some times.

I was really surprised that their food was almost too salty. You NEVER get that at the usual Tex-Mex/Mexican restaurants around here. They ALWAYS lack seasoning. Here the salt might be a bit on the heavy side but still good.

Still the food was great. I have not tried a la carte but it would be good too I guess.

I recommend you to go here to try something different than the ordinary tex-mex restaurant. Just do NOT add salt to your food until you taste it ;o)

data.title: Don't miss this small hideaway restaurant
data.text: What a great place to enjoy lunch. The food was very authentic and delicious. I have been there with friends many times and try to eat there whenever I am in downtown Conroe.

data.title: Good Eats
data.text: Went to the lunch with a friend there and it was darn good. They have buffet style serving and they will make what ever your desire is. I also went back with my wife and she really enjoyed it!

data.title: Great Old Mesico Food
data.text: Love the breakfasts!  The buffet is also good with a nice variety and fresh items.  Very reasonably priced and convenient to downtown Conroe.
